channel.title: Can I run a server on one commputer but source on annother?
channel.description: Hola, if this is like a reeallyy stupid question sorry im new :p. Well i made my server in a source by using Hamachi on my laptop. But nobody will join cause it is "Hamachi" So since my laptop doesnt have a router it is connected to my router down stairs wireless thus i dont think i can portforward from it "can i?". So... Do i need to transfer my source to my very slow pc downstairs to portforward with UTorrent and Comcast? Or can i have the source up on my laptop and just run the server up here while i portforward it downstairs? If that makes sense xD.

item.title: Can I run a server on one commputer but source on annother?
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

that hes trying to use no-ip if u read… and portforward if u read the rest of it and next time dont bring up hamachi dont hate u hater hamachi isnt bad it uses ppl w/o portforward 4 ppl who cant portforward use it u tart head maybe u shuld go back to school cuz u cant understand a word im saying but i bet other ppl can!

Read full topic

item.title: Can I run a server on one commputer but source on annother?
item.dc:creator: @imsokool22 imsokool22
item.description:
@imsokool22 wrote:

truely it doesnt matter wher u port forward ur router but if the source isnt on the computer u want to then u cant host it off a different computer i dont totally uderstand what ur saying but if thats was it <that was the answer u culd port forward ur router even if it wuz locked up in a secret room as long as u can acess ur router(wireless) then u can portforward on it by using ur router ip for a linksys the ip shuld be 192.168.1.1 i think[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 23, 2009, 04:07:33 pm[/size][hr]ollie plz dont correct ppl cuz he wuz saying that umm u can run it anywhere as long as u can access it

Read full topic

item.title: Can I run a server on one commputer but source on annother?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

No because condensation from the cold fridge would get on the hot router and then the circuit board would short-circuit.

Read full topic
